## replace_pattern
```python
from FileJanitor import replace_pattern

replace_pattern("_", " & ", "docs/") # Renames files like: "file_janitors.txt" -> "file & janitors.txt"
replace_pattern("_", " ")  # Uses current directory, renames files like: "my_file.txt" -> "my file.txt"
```

**Before:**
```bash
docs/
├── file_janitors.txt
├── report_v1_final.pdf
└── my_file.txt
```

**After:**
```bash
docs/
├── file & janitors.txt
├── report & v1 & final.pdf
└── my & file.txt
```

## standardize_filename
```python
from FileJanitor import standardize_filename

standardize_filename("data/", case="title", sep="-") # Renames files in data/ like: "my file NAME.txt" -> "My-File-Name.txt"
```

**Before:**
```bash
data/
├── my file NAME.txt
├── Another_Report.csv
└── messy  name--file.pdf
```

**After:**
```bash
data/
├── My-File-Name.txt
├── Another-Report.csv
└── Messy-Name-File.pdf
```

## index_files
```python
from FileJanitor import index_files

index_files("my_thesis", order = ["intro.pdf", "analysis.pdf", "discussion.pdf", "conclusions.pdf"])
```

**Before:**
```bash
my_thesis/
├── discussion.pdf
├── intro.pdf
├── conclusions.pdf
└── analysis.pdf
```

**After:**
```bash
my_thesis/
├── 01_intro.pdf
├── 02_analysis.pdf
├── 03_discussion.pdf
└── 04_conclusions.pdf
```

## flatten
```python
from FileJanitor import flatten

flatten("data/", recursive=True)
```

**Before:**
```bash
cwd/
├── data/
│   ├── raw/
│   │   └── file1.csv
│   └── processed/
│       └── file2.csv
```

**After:**
```bash
cwd/
├── file1.csv
├── file2.csv
```
